title: The Lindbergh Baby Poster Font
content:
I was just looking threw an old infamous crimes book when I found this poster and was wondering what font was used?

[http://i44.tinypic.com/hvyyw5.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019161244/http:/i44.tinypic.com/hvyyw5.jpg "http://i44.tinypic.com/hvyyw5.jpg")
author: E. Scrooge

comments.content:
There's some Franklin Gothic in there.

- Lex

Yep, the smaller stuff is Franklin Gothic. The condensed face in the middle appears to be [Alternate Gothic No. 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019161244/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/alternate-gothic/) and the face at the top is an old wood typeface. An old type catalog I have only gives it a number--735--no name.
